content.question:
Both graphs are shown in the x y plane. All coordinates are approximate. For both functions, the x axis ranges from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1. 

The graph of f is a straight line passing through (0 comma negative 1) and (2 comma 0).

For the graph of the function g, moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (negative 4.5 comma 3.2).

The curve decreases to cross the x axis at (negative 2 comma 0).

The curve continues to decrease to cross the y axis at (0 comma negative 1).

The curve continues to decrease to reach a low point at (0.5 comma negative 1.1).

The curve then increases to cross the x axis at (3 comma 0 and exit the window at (4.5 comma 1.5).

​The graphs of the polynomial functions <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> are shown. The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator f open parentheses x close parentheses over denominator g open parentheses x close parentheses end fraction"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math>. What are all vertical asymptotes of the graph of <math alttext="y equals h open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="x equals negative 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and ​<math alttext="x equals 3"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> only

​<math alttext="x equals negative 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, ​<math alttext="x equals 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, and ​<math alttext="x equals 3"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="x equals negative 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and ​<math alttext="x equals 3"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> only

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
